body_html: @prb12 Interesting, in 0.11 the summary_scalar function only can handle a tensor as input name, but now in 1.0,summary.scalar can only handle a python string? That means the use of placeholder as a prefix-name in summary in 0.11 can not be implemented in 1.0 version unless you open a session to get eval(), very interesting change, may I ask is there any alternative way to use placeholder for summary.scalar without the eval() in a session. As the old summary_scalar function give the use of placeholder as a tutorial.

That means the use of placeholder as a prefix-name in summary in 0.11 can not be implemented in 1.0 version unless you open a session to get eval(), very interesting change, may I ask is there any alternative way to use placeholder for summary.scalar without the eval() in a session. As the old summary_scalar function give the use of placeholder as a tutorial.
